intro: Alsine rubra var. alpina, commonly known as the alpine red sandwort, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the family Caryophyllaceae, characterized by its succulent leaves and showy, pinkish-red flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine meadows and mountainous areas. Its small, clustered flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and it is adapted to cold, harsh environments. The species is known for its resilience and is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value in rock gardens.
